author: pandapip1
content: The notation I use is `address(0)`, if anyone wants to adopt that

author: ralexstokes
content: `address(0)` to me means to "cast" the numeric value 0 to an 'address' which seems like an easy footgun to send funds to `0x00..00` -- i think it is important to clarify that contract creations in this manner do not go to any address

author: rodrigoh0623
content:
Here is the implementation from the ethereumjs evm, so it can become more clear: https://github.com/ethereumjs/ethereumjs-monorepo/blob/master/packages/evm/src/evm.ts#L750

It just checks if message.to is empty, if it is an address (address(0)) included, then it is a normal call (not create) as <@539495253418180618> and <@543900561460822016> said. 

Just sending it in case someone prefers to look at the code
